content.html: Mention units?

content.html: doen. 0d6dcd1

content.raw: It would be nice to give some explanation of what the filter is, is it a subset of regex?
content.html: It would be nice to give some explanation of what the filter is, is it a subset of regex?

content.raw: I think it's modified regex to support wildcard character `*`. That character gets translated to `.*` when doing regex string matching.
content.html: I think it's modified regex to support wildcard character *. That character gets translated to .* when doing regex string matching.

content.raw: I realize that this is done in order not to break ABI, but this will be shared among all instances of `LinkState`, and that's probably not what we want. We could at least add a message here that this should be fixed when merging forward to gazebo 9.
content.html: I realize that this is done in order not to break ABI, but this will be shared among all instances of LinkState, and that's probably not what we want. We could at least add a message here that this should be fixed when merging forward to gazebo 9.

content.html: added comment. 0d6dcd1

content.html: Maybe we can make the precision configurable too... in the future...

content.raw: agreed
content.html: agreed

content.raw: Is there a reason why the precision for models is different from the precision for links?
content.html: Is there a reason why the precision for models is different from the precision for links?

content.html: not sure, I've changed it to 4. 0d6dcd1

content.html: The precision was 3 (see old line 247)

content.raw: What if something was scaled up, and then back to the default scale?
content.html: What if something was scaled up, and then back to the default scale?

content.raw: I removed the check, so scaling is always logged now. 0d6dcd1
content.html: I removed the check, so scaling is always logged now. 0d6dcd1

content.raw: That should be fine. The default value of scale is [1, 1, 1], and also look at the ModelState::Load function.
content.html: That should be fine. The default value of scale is [1, 1, 1], and also look at the ModelState::Load function.

content.raw: We currently support scaling a model while logging, and the scale is properly changed during playback. In case there is a model which for example, keeps going back and forth between scale [2, 2, 2] and scale [1, 1, 1], the transition from 2 to 1 won't be properly logged if we keep this check.
content.html: We currently support scaling a model while logging, and the scale is properly changed during playback. In case there is a model which for example, keeps going back and forth between scale [2, 2, 2] and scale [1, 1, 1], the transition from 2 to 1 won't be properly logged if we keep this check.

content.raw: My understanding is that a transition to [1, 1, 1] is implicit with the lack of the `<scale>` tag. If a model in time=1 has `<scale>2 2 2</scale>` and in time=2 has no `<scale>` element, then gazebo should scale the model from [2 2 2] to [1 1 1].
content.html: My understanding is that a transition to [1, 1, 1] is implicit with the lack of the <scale> tag. If a model in time=1 has <scale>2 2 2</scale> and in time=2 has no <scale> element, then gazebo should scale the model from [2 2 2] to [1 1 1].

content.raw: Should we enforce the `-r/--record` option when using `--record_filter` or `--record_period`?
content.html: Should we enforce the -r/--record option when using --record_filter or --record_period?

content.raw: I think currently if `--record_encoding` or `--record_path` is specified without `-r` then recording will still be off. We can change it so that if any one of `--record_` is specified, we turn on recording by default. This is a change in program behavior, should it be something for `default`?
content.html: I think currently if --record_encoding or --record_path is specified without -r then recording will still be off. We can change it so that if any one of --record_ is specified, we turn on recording by default. This is a change in program behavior, should it be something for default?

content.raw: I would say that it is depending if we consider the situation a bug or an 'enhanced feature' . Personally I see no problem on leaving the change for default and keep the functionality working as it is now. We could even make the gazebo nvocation fail with a descriptive error message if `-r` is missing and the user is using the other recording parameters.
content.html: I would say that it is depending if we consider the situation a bug or an 'enhanced feature' . Personally I see no problem on leaving the change for default and keep the functionality working as it is now. We could even make the gazebo nvocation fail with a descriptive error message if -r is missing and the user is using the other recording parameters.

content.raw: ok I see. I think after reading @chapulina 's comment, we should keep the old behavior. This lets user sets the various record parameters and turn on recording later.
content.html: ok I see. I think after reading @chapulina 's comment, we should keep the old behavior. This lets user sets the various record parameters and turn on recording later.

content.raw: I think right now it's possible to set the encoding during startup, but only start recording later on, using that encoding.
content.html: I think right now it's possible to set the encoding during startup, but only start recording later on, using that encoding.

content.raw: Not sure about explicitly using `LogRecord` here. The world state is used for other things besides logging.
content.html: Not sure about explicitly using LogRecord here. The world state is used for other things besides logging.

content.raw:
I'm getting a memory problem on my Xenial system when I do the following steps:

* `gazebo -r --record_filter "double_pendulum*|unit_box*" --verbose`
* Insert a double pendulum from the GUI
* Insert a iRobot create
* close gazebo window

If prior to close the gazebo window using the X button of the window manager I run `gz log -d 0` then the problem disappeared. I don't know if it is under the scope of this PR to fix this.
content.html:
I'm getting a memory problem on my Xenial system when I do the following steps:

  • gazebo -r --record_filter "double_pendulum*|unit_box*" --verbose
  • Insert a double pendulum from the GUI
  • Insert a iRobot create
  • close gazebo window

If prior to close the gazebo window using the X button of the window manager I run gz log -d 0 then the problem disappeared. I don't know if it is under the scope of this PR to fix this.

content.raw: I think the memory is growing because data are being buffered. If you run it long enough, some data should be written out to file. When you close the gazebo window, it will also force the data to be written out, same for `gz log -d 0`.
content.html: I think the memory is growing because data are being buffered. If you run it long enough, some data should be written out to file. When you close the gazebo window, it will also force the data to be written out, same for gz log -d 0.

content.raw: If I run `gazebo -r --record_period=1 --verbose` and insert a double pendulum and other models, I get nothing recorded on my Xenial system. If I change the command and take the `record_period` out  the record is working again. Am I using it badly?
content.html: If I run gazebo -r --record_period=1 --verbose and insert a double pendulum and other models, I get nothing recorded on my Xenial system. If I change the command and take the record_period out the record is working again. Am I using it badly?

content.raw:
mm I just tried it and I can see the inserted models when I play back with `gazebo -p`. I imagine this was a problem before 004b23e, which should be fixed now. 

Are you checking with `gz log -e -f`? Insertions will not appear in the printed sdf file and is being addressed in pull request #2608
content.html:
mm I just tried it and I can see the inserted models when I play back with gazebo -p. I imagine this was a problem before 004b23e, which should be fixed now.

Are you checking with gz log -e -f? Insertions will not appear in the printed sdf file and is being addressed in pull request #2608

content.raw: I just confirmed that it is working fine. I was confused by the lack of state.log file during the execution of gazebo but that is probably because the writing buffer was not full so no disk operation at all until I finish the simulator.
content.html: I just confirmed that it is working fine. I was confused by the lack of state.log file during the execution of gazebo but that is probably because the writing buffer was not full so no disk operation at all until I finish the simulator.
